title: Can virtual reality be used to cure psychological issues? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on the psychological issues. VR has already been used to treat and/or cure multiple phobias - generating a safe space to experience the thing (however dangerous) until it becomes comfortable enough to no longer be an irrational fear. VR has also been used for a vast array of other psychological conditions. That said, VR is never going to treat (let alone cure) every psychological issue, considering many are part of the very way the brain functions for particular individuals.

Yes. I know of a group in Montreal that have been using VR for years as a tool for physiological treatment and analysis. Specifically, they were using VR to simulate escenarios not possible with living human beings. Let’s say they simulated improper interactions between human beings.
